alert.note: Alert for Rio Blanco (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 27 at 1:40PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Colorado, including the following county, Rio Blanco. * WHEN...Until 445 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 137 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms 28 miles southeast of Rangely. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 0.8 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Black Sulphur Creek, Hunter Creek, Fawn Creek, Yellow Creek, Ryan Gulch, Eureka Creek and Piceance Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... areas along Piceance Creek Road south of Highway 64 and mainly rural areas of South Central Rio Blanco County
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
